@mitchellharper Soon, incumbents will start shopping for startups that run out of $ and pick up some good ones for 10-20% of last round val.
@mitchellharper Having negative LTV:CAC to win market share is a bad strategy normally but a TERRIBLE strategy in this climate.
@mitchellharper It also means consolidation by industry as the top 2 co's will keep raising while others will run out of cash/market share.
@mitchellharper Hence having 18 months of cash and/or being profitable means you can ignore the next 1-2 year period of negative sentiment.
@mitchellharper Startups are cyclical just like any other asset class, but most great startups were launched at the bottom of a prev cycle.
@mitchellharper A great example is "Uber for X". Some great co's but getting squeezed on valuation because of macro AND industry pessimism.
Two things to watch when raising $: macro trends and industry sentiment. You can't control either but they affect your valuation.

Bigcommerce fun fact #10: I like tweeting about things I find interesting about Bigcommerce over the last 6 years.

Bigcommerce fun fact #8: we ended up in Austin by chance, based on a recommendation from an early mentor @chanimalted.
Bigcommerce fun fact #7: the company is a success because of early mentors including @caseygollan and @TonyRobbins and his master coaches.
Bigcommerce fun fact #6: Ed and I played Street Fighter in the early days til 3am. We have Street Fighter in every company office today.
Bigcommerce fun fact #5: when we launched in 2009 there were literally over 500 competitors. Everything from open source to enterprise.
Bigcommerce fun fact #4: we had planned to stay bootstrapped, but knew we could build a $B business that would help millions of SMBs grow.
Bigcommerce fun fact #3: The MVP was built in 6 months by me & @surfichris, essentially locked up in a Rozelle terrace (with harbour views).

20/ 2015 resolution ideas: properly structure a personal roadmap for 2015 using my template as a guide: http://t.co/wymWTrCKHX
19/ 2015 resolution ideas: move all social media/time wasting apps off the first screen on your phone to the 2nd/3rd screen and in a folder.
18/ 2015 resolution ideas: take a photo of yourself, print it out and stick it on your wall with a photo of how you want to look in 1 year.
17/ 2015 resolution ideas: give away 10% of your income and time to one charity you're passionate about. Concentrate your focus to do more.
16/ 2015 resolution ideas: put your ego aside and be the first to reach out and start repairing that broken relationship.
15/ 2015 resolution ideas: say no to things you don't want to do, that will be a waste of time or that will anger/upset you.
14/ 2015 resolution ideas: stop comparing your progress to others. Compare your progress against yourself year on year.
13/ 2015 resolution ideas: start a blog on a topic you're passionate about and don't try to make money from it.
12/ 2015 resolution ideas: skip going out for lunch 2-3 times a week and go to the gym during that time instead (+ pack a lunch).
11/ 2015 resolution ideas: leverage your time by hiring someone to do tasks where your time is worth more than $, ex cleaning, research.
10/ 2015 resolution ideas: learn about pH levels in food, their impact on your health and reduce the amount of acid-forming foods you eat.
9/ 2015 resolution ideas: do @timferriss's simple food program to lose 20 LBS in January: http://t.co/QrSdO3pmCd
8/ 2015 resolution ideas: get rid of people in your life who are too negative, too self-focused or just a pain in the a** to be around.
7/ 2015 resolution ideas: figure out how to 10x the amount of value you create, which will 5x the income you generate.
6/ 2015 resolution ideas: put your kids before work by scheduling activities into your calendar and treat them as non-negotiable.
5/ 2015 resolution ideas: mentor someone who was where you were 5-10 years ago in a topic you're passionate about and good at.
4/ 2015 resolution ideas: stop watching the news, period.
3/ 2015 resolution ideas: commit to write down your goals and give each a deadline and a 5-10 bullet point plan of attack.
2/ 2015 resolution ideas: reduce the amount of TV you watch by 1 hour a day and use that time to learn a new skill.
1/ 2015 resolution ideas: commit to read one book a month

A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 44) An intra-workout supplement gives you more strength during ur workout
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 43) Don't count calories - understand macros and approx calories per meal
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 42) Build your routine into a 45 minute session inc 90 secs between sets
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 41) Supersets let you get 2x the work done in about 2/3 the time
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 40) Use NET time - learn while working out w podcast, Youtube, Kindle etc
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 39) If a muscle feels tender/abnormal, don't keep going - get checked
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 38) Creatine does help you lift more despite water retention
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 37) Don't skip legs - train them hard, big impact on hormone regulation
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 36) Before every meal ask will this move me toward or away from my goal?
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 35) you can use Youtube to learn everything you need if youre resourceful
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 34) Use http://t.co/2zgGVNIdgE to see gyms in hotels when you travel
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 33) when interviewing/pitching/etc, physical appearance alters opinions
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 32) Only take advice from people with the body you want - and act on it
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 31) Keep rest between sets to 90 secs to keep heart rate up
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 30) If you plateau, check your diet first then workout and ask for advice
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 29) Few things make you feel mentally better than a hard workout
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 28) Find someone with the body you want and ask how they got it then copy
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 27) Have someone who can kick your ass for missing a workout, i.e. coach
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 26) Review progress every month and be proud of even small gains
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 25) By working out you will inspire people close to you to hit the gym
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 24) Create a workout playlist on Spotify to push you through the workout
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 23) Have step goals, i.e. don't go from 20% BF to 10% but 20->18->14 etc
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 22) You can't manage what you don't measure - get the Aria Fitbit scale
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 21) Your kids do what you do, not what you say so lead by example.
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 20) Lighter weights with good form is better than heavy w poor form.
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 19) Make workout out a "must" not a "should".
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 18) If you don't like an exercise change it. You must love your workout.
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 17) Excuses and laziness are the 2 big things to overcome to get in shape
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 16) Have 1 week off every 8 weeks to let  muscles and body recover
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 15) Have 2-3 cheat meals per week but eat clean 90% of the time
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 14) Have a "green drink" (spinach+kale+lemon) to keep alkalinity balanced
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 13) Figure out your body type and eat within that profile- ecto, meso etc
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 12) Health is the key to happiness and having a high self esteem
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 11) If you feel down, get in the gym. It will clear your mind.
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 10) Set a weight goal for the year & don't compare progress to others
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 9) Mix whey with casein protein before bed 50/50 to feed muscle o'night
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 8) Every workout go up in weight/reps/less rest for at least one exercise
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 7) Use Evernote to track your sets/reps/weight for every workout
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 6) Cut fat and then go for muscle, doing both at the same time is tough
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 5) Build a gym at home and treat workouts like meetings, i.e. never miss
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 4) Lifting 4x a week instead of 3x creates 2x more gains in 1/2 time
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 3) Lifting heavy will keep your hormones in check and stress right down
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 2) A pre-workout and a banana will let you lift more with less recovery.
A few things I've learned about working out in the last few years: 1) Working out in the morning gets your mind right for the day.
